lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you should go check it out. Plus we get to show them the strength of the Critter nation, you guys go ahead and click on the link and say hello.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, mobilize.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also have until the 19th of this month at 9:00pm to subscribe to receive the next month's Loot Crate in time, otherwise the cutoff happens, and the next one looks pretty cool. So you guys should definitely try and get into that window if you can. Let me see. There is a-- oh! Our first "Dear Vox Machina" article went up last week, answered by our fantastic Scanlan Shorthalt over there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So funny!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can find that on the Geek and Sundry website. If you haven't had a chance to check it out, you can check it out on geekandsundry.com. We have a new one coming out tomorrow--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Featuring? Featuring?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --featuring, do we know who it's featuring? Do we know? Vax is helming that one next week, so that'll be fun. Check it out at geekandsundry.com for Vax's answering questions sent to him by various people who live all about Tal'Dorei and beyond.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's have a heart-to-heart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, what could possibly go wrong?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He walks away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or hits them in the head with a--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I didn't answer any of them, I just left it and took a walk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. I will be a guest at the end of this month, the last weekend in May, at Momocon in Atlanta, as a reminder for all you southern East-coast folks. Looking forward to coming there and doing some panels and such. And then the weekend after that, the first weekend of June, I will be at Akon in Dallas, Texas. So for all you Texas folk they just finally announced that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Woo, Dallas.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to these folks' old neck of the woods. So if you're in that area, come say hi at Akon, be a lot of fun. Oh and Travis, you're going to a convention next weekend.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, Laura and I will be at Puerto Rico Comic Con next weekend. The 21st and the 22nd, or the 20th and the 21st, whatever Saturday and Sunday is. We'll be there! Come squeeze us, we'll sign your books--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Squeeze us?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Here we go, it'll be hitting you real soon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everything shrivels. And Taliesin, you will be at another convention as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will, I will be at Amazing Comic Con in Hawaii next weekend. Actually, I will be missing the game because I will be working on my pale, in the moonlit shores of Hawaii.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I love how well your shirt and your hoodie match your hair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know, it looks so pretty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is pretty slick, actually.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. This is as fresh as I can get. Because I've been sleeping in the studio.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's pretty fresh. So fresh and so clean.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You look like a Wicked and Divine character. It's pretty great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What color will you be next week?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You know, I think I'm going to stick with the lavender for a while. I think I'm slowly going to move it towards amethyst.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hey, I like it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Little green, little blue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, as a note, Taliesin is the new host of Signal Boost. The next run on the show that Marisha is the creator and co-producer on, writer, all that other fun stuff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Along with Shaun Becker and Eric Campbell. Couldn't do it without those guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You had a fun promo go up this week as a teaser for it. That was rather fun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Check it out. It's very good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed. And I want to say, though it's only been a couple days past, happy birthday to Marisha. Happy birthday this past Tuesday to Marisha.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was added after I sent out the announcements.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was added right now because I'm your boyfriend. But yeah, happy birthday.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aw, thanks, babe.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We love our druid!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aw, thanks, guys.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Huzzah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Speaking of birthdays, I believe there is a gift to be given?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I don't have an announcement, but I have a bit of a surprise. This is a little bit early, because my sister and I share a birthday on the 28th. However!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: May birthdays!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's very timely. Ryan, if you please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? What is this thing? Is it a baby bear cub? Is it a real bear cub?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is fantastic.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. My. Gosh. Shut your face!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Lookit! Look at what it says.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks brother!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All the barf. That's so cute!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, I want to ride it around right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's got a little bend in it for your butt!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it really fly though, that's the thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know, maybe have some padding or mattresses out the first time you use it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (squeals) Oh, this is so cool!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I also thought it would look nice in the house.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It'll look so good in the house! It's so perfect. It's going to go on the mantle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hold it up a little higher so the people can see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sings) That was Ariel, singing Little Mermaid.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (sings)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keep singing!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm a big fan of all your decisions, keep making them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, brother. Thank you so much. I don't have your gift for you here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whatevs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She dropped it in a portapotty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Make him hold it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make Trinket hold a broom. This is going to go perfectly. It does actually work!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, yeah no, that's rockin'!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's perfect!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I love it so much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you, that's so wonderful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't steal it, Trinket! You won't fit on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything else anyone wants to say or shall we jump into it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess we should also say thank you, Hardwick--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Battled the dragon, and amongst their losses came to an accord in which they would leave riches for the dragon and it would let them be for the time being. Upon making their way into the town, thinning some of the ranks of this ravenous herd, Travis as Grog threatened Kevdak to a battle one-on-one for supremacy of the herd, and quickly may have gotten in a little over his head. In the center of the town square, a great battle commenced, where after calling to his side his friends Vox Machina, a bloody fray that nearly felled a few of you, through some ingenuity, some decent planning, and some trickery of magical item use, you managed to survive and have Grog deal the death blow to Kevdak, amongst all of the watching herd. After some barely scraping by diplomacy, managed to bring it all to a ceasefire for the time being, freed Kevdak's son, your cousin Zanror, who from his bindings seemed to be of a different mentality, emotional mindset than his father was, and is now wishing to-- with the two of you, being Vox Machina and the remainder of the Herd-- bring this fight to the black dragon itself, pulling themselves from under the thumb of its rule, thus saving Westruun and your own lives in the process. You all have brought to life one child who was lost in this fray, and are currently escorting this boy northward towards the temple district of Westruun, and that was where we left off last time. So. As you guys recovered somewhat, some of your wounds, taken a breather, begin walking through the now slowly unrolling streets of Westruun, some folks are coming out, some are still staying in, because there are still various druids, warriors of a very aggressive nature wandering the streets, though sparser than before, seeing you guys walk through, as many people do recognize you through your previous exploits, building a little sense of security they have not had for the better part of a week. Making your way northward with this little boy, you eventually find your way into the outskirts of the temple district, the very familiar half-toppled stone wall that in a circular way encompasses this portion of the northwestern side of Westruun. What would you like to do?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, I would like to make a proposition, if everybody would like to take a rest, I know I'm pretty rough right now and maybe we could go see if my great-great grandfather is okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We were in the process of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Escorting this boy to his home.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was the three ladies, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we'll bring him home, then we'll find your grandfather.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or we can take him home and meet you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Who-- how-- where is--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Little dead boy?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The little boy is still clutching on to Trinket's fur, riding him behind you, he's got a little smile on his face, the dried blood still covering half of his smile.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does any of this look familiar to you, darling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah. Mom should be up that way." And he points further down the thoroughfare.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's close.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. And your grandfather lives in this area as well.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't see why we can't do both.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Swing by his house, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Giddy-up!" And he kicks the side, and Trinket like, (grunts), lumbers forward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pat Trinket's butt. It's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Licks your hand begrudgingly and continues forward, plodding on the cobblestone. For a while, eventually the boy, looking for familiar sights, some of the buildings have taken some damage in the initial black dragon onslaught, he does suddenly point his finger forward and goes, "That's it! That's it!" And you go past a couple of humble buildings, and then you start getting into the slum section. I say slum, it's where the poor people in the temple district live when they're not tending to temples or businesses that are surrounded by this district. You can see it's a functional, it's a standing hovel, but it's mainly a scrap wood roof, bits of thatch to help maintain any protection against rainfall. The wood looks old, some of it may have been rotted, but treated since. It's functional. But the boy jumps off Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, be careful!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doesn't even pay attention to you, runs up to the door and hits the door and it's solid. He goes and pulls on it and it seems to be closed, so he goes, "Mommy? Mommy?" He seems genuinely excited, but also trying to get in the front door.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I walk up behind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I whisper to Pike and be like, mm, we didn't think about this potential outcome, did we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hello? Is anyone home? It's relatively safe--er. Than it was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Time passes. What are you doing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I check the door, if it's locked?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door itself doesn't have a knob per se, it has a small dark iron handle that's bolted to it, but you pull it and something's holding it back, like there's something actually barring it from the other side.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's a good thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A few moments pass. Silence.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Child, how long has it been since you've been away from your home?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They just pulled me out today." Then you hear a voice come from the other side of the wooden door, peeking through the space. "Hello?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Knock-knock, we have your son, safe and sound.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Delivery.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Special delivery for child's mum.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Theodore?" And the boy goes, "Yes? Mom? Please please please! There's nice people out here." And you hear the shifting of wood onto the side, the door opens ever so slightly and on the inside you can see a pale and scared-looking woman, clean, simple clothing, has some sort of half-torn apron on that's wrapped around a simple peasant blouse. She has her hair up in this small cloth cap and she pushes through. "Theodore!" Opens the door and picks him up and wraps him in her arms and holds him for a second, not even paying attention to any of you, and there's this moment where you can see the fear that has been stuck in her mind since he was pulled from the inside of their abode slowly abated with the return. Eventually she stops and her eyes come up over his shoulder to the rest of you. "I'm sorry, pardon my manners, I'm Yulia. Thank you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course. Well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Puts Theodore down. "Hold on, let me--" She goes and steps inside of her home. Eventually a few moments later she comes back and she has a small handful of coins.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, darling, put that away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I-- it's the least I can do."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Truly, put that away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're just glad he's home safe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And not even slightly dead!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nope! Not a scratch!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He's fine, just nothing even happened.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If he has weird dreams-- don't worry about it. Children, you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Her eyes are partially trained on Grog as she now notices you, she steps further out of the house, she's like, "Is everything okay now?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah, he killed the bad guy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're under new management now, going to be a lot of changes around here. For the better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay. Thank you." She cups the coins back into her hand, reaches down and rubs Theodore's hair, looks at the blood that's still there and looks a little worried for a second.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it's paint, I think it might be paint, they were painting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Is he going to be all right?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah, he's great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We had spaghetti for lunch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Quite an adventure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Give him a little hot cocoa, warm blanket, he'll be fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Better go clean you up. Go clean you up." And he's like, "Okay!" And he runs in behind her as she turns again and takes the door and pauses for a moment looking out at you and says once again, very quietly under her breath, "Thank you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you-- sorry. Have you seen a small elderly-- an older gnome?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Wilhand?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, have you seen him, is he all right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We've been staying inside since the incursion came."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The few that I have seen were not under good circumstances. But the fact that I haven't "seen him might be a good thing."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know if they were hiding anywhere? If anyone else went anywhere specifically to hide?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not a lot of places to hide. Only certain areas in the sewers are safe, and our homes are "the best places, if we knew our way around our own homes. We had a hiding spot, but Theodore got away "from us, hearing all the noise, and they managed to take him away."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where did you hide?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or who are skilled in it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trained in it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You can try.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Have a proficiency.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This back room was a shrine to Melora, and has since been seemingly tossed aside in the hurried state of trying to protect one's family.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I reach down and pick up the statue?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's in three pieces. As you pick it up, she goes, "Oh, I'm so sorry, we--" She goes for your hand and goes, "I didn't-- hopefully she'll forgive us, I know she will."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tell me about this deity.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Melora?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Melora.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you've heard Melora, it's a whole section of Vasselheim that is based around her sphere of influence, and she is actually where most of the food in Vasselheim is grown in such a cold environment, her blessing is what allows the land there to be fertile for crops from many different places.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sweet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But she tells you, and you can see the symbols too, the symbols that are carved in the side of the stone are these swirls, almost like a slow cascading spiral. She says, "Melora watches "over nature, she watches to make sure we have a good harvest, she makes sure we don't get washed "away in the storms, she makes sure that the ships to the far west make their passage across the "ocean, she looks out for us smaller folk and brings vengeance upon those who attempt to destroy "our life." As she looks distantly out the open door behind you into the city itself. "But anyway, "I'll repair that."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I might be able to help. Can I attempt-- hang on-- can I attempt a Mending spell on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you can. You take a moment, close your hands around it, close your eyes, and you can see what little bit of dried grass or moss that's gathered at the edges of the stone all of a sudden spreads and encompasses all the pieces of stone as you're holding it together. She takes a step back, her eyes full of wonder, as the moss then turns dark brown, like a shell of soft vegetation, and then cracks and falls away, leaving behind the stone statue in one piece.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's sick!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sweet!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hand it over, and I tell her, I'm a druid of the Ashari people and I know several worshippers of Melora, but wasn't necessarily a believer of her powers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She protects you, too."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And you're sure of this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks over to her child, who's now sitting on the side, pulled a couple of these wooden toys out from the side and is gathering them in his arms and is grabbing all the things that he missed while he was taken away, and she says, "She brought you to me. She brought you to him."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why should I believe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She'll show you. In her own way."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you, my lady.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes the statue and, "Well, if there's anything else I can do for you."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, actually. You should leave. I don't mean that in the way that it sounded, sorry, back up. So, come tomorrow, there might be danger in Westruun. You and your kin should go. In fact, anyone that you see, take them with you, there's a little encampment not far from here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There is?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, all the shanty area of people--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, oh, the refugees.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They were south of here by Foromir Basin.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: South, north, northwest. South.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's over by Foromir Basin. Head for that if you can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Look for no trees.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes a mental note. "No trees. All right. I haven't been that far south. Should we "get the others, should we tell others to come with us? If there is danger here--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to fight here? I thought we were going to do this out of town.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's a fight coming here. You don't want to be here. Don't be too obvious about it, on the sly, if you can, but try and make your way out of here before dawn tomorrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay, we will. Theodore? Start gathering your things, we're taking a little trip."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A fun trip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "A trip! Yay!" And starts gathering more of his things, he gets a pillow case and starts putting stuff into it. "We haven't done a trip-- we haven't done a trip!" "I know. Thank you."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: On second thought, should we ask them to leave on the sly, like, through the sewers? Just in case.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wouldn't make a show of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So maybe underground if they can.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're going to have-- are we here? I can't remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you're all together.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought we weren't either, I thought it was just the girls but then everyone started talking.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And then Grog was here. Reality is very malleable.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're going to have to have a larger conversation about where everybody ends up in the very near future, and while two people in and out of town is definitely agreeable, I think there's a larger discussion to be had.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have an odd question for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you know of anyone still in the city who would know their way about the sewers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean-- usually the guards would go through and make sure that the things that were "living down there weren't living anymore, but-- I don't know anyone in particular that worked down "there. Sorry."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know someone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why don't we let this woman return to the rest of her day?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have more appointments as well. Much to do today.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) One last question, this is it, I swear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you familiar with anyone in the farming area just outside of town?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've seen some folks come and go."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're looking for a woman who was a daughter of one of the gentlemen that worked in the fields, and we really have no idea how to go about finding her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) Reginald.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Reginald's daughter, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Reginald's daughter. I'll ask."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. You know where to find us, we'll be about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I know who to have that discussion with as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good day. Oh?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I go over to Theodore and-- I don't think I have to bend down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, no, he's maybe half an inch shorter than you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I had a little wooden doll, and so I'm going to pass it to him and say, in case we never see you again, you can always think of us when you play with this. That's for you. And you can name him whatever you want.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's your name?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pulling more things in the pillowcase.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Theodore!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So much better alive than dead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know! I mean, good thing he never died.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, a rare ray of sunshine from the DM today.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's continue on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't poke him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys say your goodbyes, she lets you go and she locks the door behind and you gather they're making their necessary preparations. Where to next?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pike.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To Wilhand's.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Follow me, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Not too far away, actually, you come to the red brick homestead where Pike, Grog, and Wilhand live. Mostly intact. The second floor, which you guys are definitely familiar with--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, I remember this place! Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's currently locked.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's a good sign. I think that's a good sign.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want to knock?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No answer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have a secret knock you maybe used?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe you should say who's knocking, just in case. You do knock so strong.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Pop-Pop Wilhand? It's Pike!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I heard that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He might have very soft footfalls.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He might not be home.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is he old and hard of hearing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: A little, he could-- a little. Vax? Would you mind? Maybe you'll get some luck with this door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Technically, Pike, you do have the keys to the home.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, I can do it if you want to.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, hold on, I forgot that somewhere in this armor--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, he needs this, he needs this, it's all right, absolutely needs this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll explode the door!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All that clanking is actually this key moving about my armor. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unlocks the door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That key has seen a lot of miles.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Been around the world.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You push and the door hits something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Damn it. Doors.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It like budges maybe a quarter-inch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's barricaded the door, that's a good thing, that's a really good thing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I go to the crack. Pop-Pop Wilhand! It's Pike!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go and look through the window, is there a window?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a window, there is cloth shuttered around it, you cannot see in the inside.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the hole in the roof. Could I get up it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could probably get up there if you wanted. Go ahead and make a-- make an athletics check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bugger all, I say we give it a shove.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes you a few minutes, but you eventually climb your way up, looking down into the second floor. Part of the roof is fully pushed in, it looks like there's a piece of wayward stone that was ejected from an impact not too far from here, possibly from one of the nearby temples, that ended up slamming through the roof. It's partially embedded in the ground, the wood's splintered up around it, but it didn't hit the bottom floor, it lodged itself in the floor of the second.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hear anything, see anything inside?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you see? Oh. Well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you at the bottom floor? Bottom floor, all, there is some furniture that's busted, but a lot of the furniture's all been pushed right to the front door. There's a giant barricade of mishmashed furniture that is jammed impossibly into this front area.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He's very strong.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to give a push to the front door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: More amusing when you consider that there's a glass window right next to it that is not blocked at all, shuttered so carefully.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a window, there's nothing in front of it, you want to come in the window?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We give a shove.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We give a big shove.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check, with advantage we'll say as you-- well, him, having advantage you're helping.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, him having advantage because I'm helping.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh. 18. Is my strength.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. You guys have to slam it a few times, and the impact lodges a few things loose. Come cascading down, causing a bit of a racket, but eventually you manage to get it pushed open enough where you guys can squeeze through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You just broke a chaise lounge, but come in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike, after you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I step in and start looking around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of the room is cold. It's quiet other than your footfalls.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I check the bedroom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You go up to the bedroom area. As you go up the stairs, you can see the giant piece of stone that's smashed in there, where the bed would be in part of the bedroom area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike, did he have any hiding places, like that other house?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I go with her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to look around for personal effects, papers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check, both of you guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there a basement here, Pike?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What were you going to say?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There are hiding places.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys go through the kitchen area, and as you are looking about, moving stuff, in the pantry area there is a small wooden slat that is partially moved across that leaves a small opening in the floorboards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Percy! Wilhand?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hello?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Shh! I'm not here!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pike, I've got good news, he says he's not here!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I go running down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you run and you push stuff out of the way. There's the one board that's slid open, all the rest of the boards are still loose and placed over it. Do you just take the boards and toss 'em up?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I just pull them off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pull the boards off, what little bit of light has made its way from the window on the far end of the kitchen, you can see a bit of glimmer off a set of glasses that immediately recoil in the shadow and go, "Oh!"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Pop-Pop Wilhand!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Pike? Oh my goodness." And his hand reaches out and grabs yours and you pull him up and he's covered in dust and dirt and he's probably been down there-- the smell, probably been down there for a few days.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I give him a big hug.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a little bit of dried food crusted on the side of his chin. But he's there with a big ol' hug. "Pike, I missed you so much."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I missed you so much, I'm so glad you're okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Look at you, look at you. Where'd you get this scar? Oh."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Long story, we'll get there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I want to hear this story-- and it's Grog!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hello Wilhand!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Runs up, goes to give you a hug and goes, "Oh! Come down, come down."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, no-- yes. Take it easy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You big guy." And his eyes go from really warm to suddenly very cold, and he goes, "They "came back for me. They came back for me. I saw 'em in the street."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know, it's all right. It's all right, Wilhand. It's all been taken care of.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They didn't find me though, they didn't find me."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You hid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There was no way they could find me. I know where "the secret places are."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I see where Pike gets her smarts from.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he starts going around and giving each of you-- you guys got the hugs, he's giving you the formal like, "Oh, yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is Vex, this is Vax.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He knows us, Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, I remember."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth, hello.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Been a while."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't actually think we've met before, hello.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, you're unfamiliar to me. Nice to see you again."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Scanlan, Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Always nice to see a fellow gnome in these parts. You are?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ah, Percival Frederickstein Von Musel Klossowski de Rolo III, it's a pleasure to meet you. Hello. Hi.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right!" And he pats your shoulder.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That took some doing, well done. I'll lean down for that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So. You need to hide too?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There was a very big battle. And Grog beat Kevdak.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Chopped him in half! Straight down the middle. Filleted him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I knew you would! You've always been the strong one."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So everything's a little bit more under control, hopefully.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A little.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Mm. Ish.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wilhand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did they want something in particular with you? Why did they want you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, they went after me years ago, nearly had me."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've heard the story, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But I escaped."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've heard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I managed to flee, and took one of their own with me."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Nursed this one back to health, we did."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank goodness.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And I think I made 'em angry, so they came to Westruun trying to get revenge on old Wilhand, "but no, too keen for that, these eyes have seen the world!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You think the goliaths--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, well of course they did!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep, that's the only reason they came here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who hasn't heard the legend of Wilhand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not many actually, I don't get out very often."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They cry your name across the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The seven seas?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No no no no. Don't give me a big head about it, it's fine."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've written many a song about you, it's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, if they're all dead, let's have a meal!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Little misunderstanding, they're not all dead. We unseated Kevdak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's dead. And so was the horrible bastard who was pouring poison in his ear. But listen, I gave power up to the Herd, to Zanror, his son.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So it's in slightly better hands. Little problem--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They want to stay and fight the dragon that's going to come back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So we need everyone in here to leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Perfect."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Perfect?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Perfect in what way, leaving or fighting the dragon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Dragon? What?!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You were aware, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (terrified noise)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Yes. Yes, that one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he starts walking back towards the hole.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: No, no no no!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I grab the back of his britches and I pull him back. Nope, nope, Wilhand.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey, guess what though? We've fought many dragons already. And guess what, I killed one!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two, three-ish?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Two or three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's my Pike! Then this is nothing! The dragonslayer, Pike Trickfoot, "come again to kill another!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's how she's known.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Great. Wondrous."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ruthless.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let me know when it's dead."

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: No, no no no.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's okay right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're glad you're safe. We want to make sure you're out of here before any real damage comes to town.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're also going to need any and all recruits that you may know of, or any favors you can call in. If we are in fact going to fight this dragon?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We haven't quite talked about--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We really should have a conversation about that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But what is known is that there's going to be a fight tomorrow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's probably going to be a fight tomorrow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And unless you want to throw down, and I know you're a mighty warrior, not saying you shouldn't, but if you don't want to, now might be the time to hop-skip out of here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's no shame in prudence.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no, not in the hole!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He swats your hand away and goes, "Heh." Goes back down into the hole, you can hear him rummaging a little bit, something falls and shatters. (incoherent grumbling) Eventually he comes back out clutching a dark brown glass bottle with a cork in it, and he goes, "I'm going to need "some of this. Ugh."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, don't be stingy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is the Trickfoot Special. Been distilling while you were away."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much you got of that, old man?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah, about two casks."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right. I drink the whole rest of the bottle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is awful. It is like potato moonshine in its most basic form. It is--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike's going to be so fucked up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You probably singed your eyebrows just putting the bottle near your face, which you don't realize, halfway through the bottle as you drink it, you pick up, oh, it burns. This burns.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Welcome to Ren Faire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Original recipe Windex. My favorite.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's a little stronger than I remember it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, Pike's at disadvantage for the rest of the day.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no. Would you all-- there's plenty more, would you all like to join me and have a sip?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm okay, I'm okay for now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, hook it up, homie.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's been a day. I will.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let me get the cups." And he goes and opens the cabinet and there's shattered glass. "Okay, no cups."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Bottle it is."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pass the bottle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys pass the bottle around, finish off the bottle, it's--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Finish the bottle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, she took most of it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think we should make a meal. He's a very good cook.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is the kitchen even functional here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there food?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know what we should do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eat food and talk about a plan?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bring him into the mansion.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could bring him into the mansion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We do need time to rest and plan.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We still have one more stop before the evening's done.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can show his people that work at the mansion how to cook, 'cause they are terrible, I can tell you that much.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're great at one dish.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You have a mansion?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do! I'm quite successful as gnomes go, in fact, before we--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Pike. He has a mansion."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He does. He does have a mansion. It's a magic mansion.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is Wilhand drunk right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks like he's coping with the past week's events.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Insight check his soberness.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's been drunk the whole time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we make the mansion, get Wilhand a room, and then go to our last destination of this night before we turn in?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we could do that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah Grog, how long do you reckon we have before your cousin wants to either talk or get busy?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we supposed to meet up with him later tonight?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He said, at dawn, we-- Wait, at dawn we fight, or at dawn we plan?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think I've ever heard anyone say "at dawn, we plan." So I'm going to assume--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: At dawn, we plan!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: At dawn, we rise and make a plan!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At dawn, we quorum!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: At dawn, we Microsoft Excel!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense he meant at dawn, to make an aggressive action.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So we have two stops before the evening's done then.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, where are we going?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a house we're supposed to plunder.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a house we're supposed to plunder, and we should plunder it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aw, really, do we give a shit about it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, we do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, you're right, we do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh right, Master Quall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Master Quall, and I will admit, I'm vaguely indifferent about whether or not he gets his property back, but I am very keen to find out what that property is, and what else he left if he left that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why don't we set up the mansion in Wilhand's house, we'll go and run our errand, and we'll come back and he'll have gotten the kitchen all up to spec.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, seeing as we might be tangling with a black dragon tomorrow, an old one, I think maybe that stuff off you're talking about--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: --god forbid.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll probably need every bit of edge we can get, so I actually agree with you for the moment, Percival, we should stop by this house.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is terrifying and this is proof that we should do it, then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we get an early, 12 Angry Men raise of hands on who if they want to fight the dragon or not? Do we want to do this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who wants to fight the dragon tomorrow?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'm down. We've got 40 goliaths with us, this is the best time to attack. No? I'm alone here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's true, it's true, I mean, it could be one of the best times to attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would like to do three more days of research and planning--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So can we make the door? Wilhand's starting to turn green.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, it's a big conversation that we should have.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's table it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The where-when-how is pretty huge.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wilhand, just give me the bottle, take it easy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel that that's not something we do spur of the moment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Let's get this man to safety and then we'll finish up our errands for the day, yes?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there anything you want to bring with you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Uh--" He starts walking over to the shrine, and he takes it off with his hand. "That's all I "need." As the head rolls off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Never saw anything.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We'll fix it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's fine. They took ol' Davin, too."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What, who?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Davin was your neighbor.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Davin was my neighbor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is he gone, is he dead?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Didn't we meet Davin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They dragged a bunch to the iron stocks. I could only hide. Your uncle's a coward, Pike. I'm "sorry. I should've helped." You get the sense now the alcohol's kicked in and he's started to go through his emotional process now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's your uncle? I thought he was your grandfather.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He's my great-grandfather.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And uncle?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's drunk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very drunk.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Come on, no more of that talk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grandfather. Let me carry that for you, before you drop it. I'll keep it safe. I'll keep it safe for you. You don't want the head to fall off it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, its head's fine. Okay." Passes it over.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I subtly pick up the head from the ground.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So we can put him in the mansion?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, yes, I'll make the mansion.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right. I kiss him on his forehead and say: it's going to be okay. Go in there, take a nap, and show them how to cook.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whispers) "He has a mansion."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (whispers) What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whispers) "A mansion!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) And he's super interested in her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're of marrying age, young Pike."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We'll talk about it later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll tell you how it is."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Mansion. I'll tell you how it is."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, I've been there! You can go stay--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You've been to his mansion?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have my own room. You can go stay in my room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know if I want to--"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey Scanlan, how will he know which room is my room?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your room is the one covered in rose petals.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Show me the mansion."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I will cast the spell, I'll sit down and start humming. (singing) My house is a very, very, very fine house. With chickens everywhere. It used to be so fair--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the shimmering doorway is conjured in the center of the room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I take him in, I show him to his room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door opens and he looks inside. "Whoa." Turns around to you, looking at you through the doorway. "It's big."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's very big.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here, come with me. I take him upstairs, take him to his room. And before I bid him adieu I say: later tonight we can discuss more, but I would like to ask for your granddaughter's hand in marriage. But I'll need your permission first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you to roll a hell of a persuasion check on this one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roll for initiative, Sam.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Roll for initiative.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, it's a 20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shut up!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But that's low for me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes: "I'll think about it. I'd like to see more of your fine abode."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I call for five servants, and I instruct them to take him wherever he'd like to go and give him whatever he needs.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Wilhand voice) "Wine cellar!"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They begin taking him on a tour of the grand estate.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't be cheap with the chicken! All right, so I scoot out back to rejoin our friends.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I assume at some point we're taking a short rest, by the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys took a short rest the end of the last session.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh lordy, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So if you wanted to use any hit dice to heal yourself at that time.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I would like to go check my room out and see how it is. See if it's okay, any damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your room is intact. It's a little dirty and some of the crumbled stone and roof part pushed its way into the room across the floor, but for the most part your room is intact. Wilhand's room, which was the main room on the upper floor, was the one that got destroyed by the fallen rubble.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. What's the plan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we split the party and send a few people to pillage this house that we were instructed to pillage?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can all do it. Let's do it together.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, I feel like this would be a group outing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to take it and I'm going to hide it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But there was some talk of needing someone to take us through the sewers, and I can go fetch someone who knows the sewers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we need to maybe have a talk about what we're doing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Talk before that happens.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Before finding your friend.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Time is of the essence.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're talking about Mr. D, I know, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, or someone with him, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right. It's a good idea, but I think we need to figure out what we're doing first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. What are we doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have no fucking clue.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What are we doing, actually?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: First, we're robbing an old man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we walk and talk?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we walk and talk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where's Master Quall's--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's at the fountain crossroads--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: --brick two-story house near the fountain?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Before we walk and talk, do we get the general idea that it's safe to walk through the city right now without being murdered? Considering we just put on the most epic Avengers-style display.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, and some people are coming to the streets, though moving quickly from destination to destination. Word has gotten around and there's been a general sense of release throughout the city. You do pass a few of the Herd members, some of which are gathering their supplies, gathering their arms, some of them are dragging the bodies of friends that had died in previous frays or just haven't been tended to. And all of them keep a very intense eye on you. Nothing aggressive, but not friendly either.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we have to convince Kevdak to abandon this plan to attack the dragon--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's dead, he's not going to do it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You all look vaguely the same to me, I'm sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Percival!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Except for this one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, he's got the beard. And the ability to kill me in my sleep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm a unique little snowflake, I take no offense.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I find you charming.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But no, we have to convince them not to do this tomorrow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, honestly, isn't the dragon going to come pick up its loot in the next couple days? It's happening tomorrow?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that perhaps if it's possible to convince them to at least wait one more cycle to heal and prepare for the battle--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know if we'll be alive in the morning. I don't know if it's occurred to any of you, but I don't particularly feel safe. I'm glad we got out of there--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm glad we have a mansion to hide in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm glad we have a mansion, I'm glad we have a Vestige because of it, but look, I got abandoned once. Think anything's changed since then?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're not good people. They killed a lot of innocents.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I genuinely don't understand the place you come from.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, neither do I. But I don't really understand much things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel much better about any decision to just leave then, although we would have to do something about the city and everyone who's in it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, there's a lot to think about, there are a lot of people still here, and I personally don't think attacking that dragon in the next few days is a wise decision. But if we do leave, what do we do with these people? They're going to be run over by these people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's possible we can wait for all of the goliaths and other barbarians to attack the dragon, and when they all leave the city, we bar them out, take the city back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And hold it against a dragon?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. The dragon could be content fighting them. We take the time and get everyone else out of the city.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are they clever enough to attack the dragon at the point at which the drop is made, or are they going to not make the drop and wait for the dragon to attack the city?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look, if it was the day before yesterday I would have said they're all fools and they're going to do it the stupid way, but I think I underestimated 'em a bit, so yeah. I think they might be a bit clever.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We also have your cousin Zanror now at the head, which seems a little bit more clever than Kevdak ever was.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We also have to empty out the prisons if we get that chance of any of the citizens they may be holding.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, look, it's not a bad call, the dragons seem to be interested in the power that they hold over the people. There's no people, no power.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Will your cousin understand that we have a bigger battle to fight?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: On the other hand--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is our battle, we're trying to kill these dragons!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: --when are we going to have a better opportunity to kill a fucking dragon than with 40 giant strapping--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two Vestiges, an army of 40 barbarians.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we going to have this discussion right here, in the street?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we're walking while we're having it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How are we going to deal with one of the largest dragons we've ever seen in the air? What are 40 goliaths going to do with something 500 feet above us, spitting bile from above?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He has to land to get his treasure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to have to make that plan at some point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If I had time, if I had a few days--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You've got a day and a half, maximum.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If we had a little bit of time or if we're really, really smart, we could theoretically rig the most epic dragon trap ever.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you think your cousin would hold for a couple more days? Could he see the sense of planning that longer?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can't leave the people in this city under the rule of any more of these monsters.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Which is why we should get them to flee.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to get people out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, because even if we somehow by some insane chance defeat the dragon, cool, we've defeated the dragon and now the city is still under control by the Herd.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, the Herd will leave, I think.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Will they? After they ransack everything again?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, that's what Grog pitched to them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Here's my vote, so I can have it said. I would rather get everyone that doesn't want to die in this town out to that encampment. If we take this meeting with Zanror, we will no longer be able to walk away. There could be a total chance that they all turn on us right then. In the throne room, in the yard, wherever we are. We could leave now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do we get everyone out?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You and Zanror seemed to have a mutual respect.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, because I just saved his life. For a second. I also beat his ass when he was little, and let me tell you a thing about grudges: they don't go away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you don't think he would hesitate in a second to turn on us?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, he's a little man, and little men have Napoleon complexes. He's this horrible elf from the West.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do have a Napoleon complex.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've seen it, it's huge.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But if everybody is out of the town, and it's empty, then won't the dragon know?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. It'll be furious.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And then won't he leave?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And he'll come find us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Anything we do here, anything we do to that dragon, anything we do in the city is likely to be known by the other wyrms.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eventually, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So if we kill that dragon, what do the other dragons do in that moment, and are we ready to take on Thordak right now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! We kill it and run.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we can't kill all of them at the same time. It's got to be a one-by-one process.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Absolutely, but are we going to try to kill the black and then go on a hunt for all these--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There are going to be consequences to this no matter what.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How big is the black dragon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you saw? Oh man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bigger than the blue, bigger than the white?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was bigger than the blue, about equal size to the white.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The white one that we killed, or the white one that we also saw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that you fought at the Keep--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that one was real bad.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where I rolled a 21 and it missed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it was, I'd say from height size of standing on its legs, probably, I dunno, 30 to 40 feet tall?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We've never fought like a full realized dragon, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've fought them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've run from them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, remember 21 missed. I can't believe I'm saying this--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but all those guys, they were, I mean. They had strong attacks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, but there might be some that can hit him when he's in the air, but not all of them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If I-- if I had time I could build a machine that might be able to trap him on the ground for at least a little while.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, if you had time. Why are we being in such a rush about this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because we know where the dragon is, we have an army, we have an opportunity, this is it. We're never going to have an army.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think-- I disagree with that, I think we'll absolutely have opportunities to have an army. And I think that if we call upon the Herd later for something like this, maybe we can get them-- I don't know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How much time are you thinking?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As much time as it takes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can't build a machine like that in under, what, a few weeks?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And what if the machine fails? We need a plan that doesn't rely on technology, I'm sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we put out the loot, let him come down and get it, and then we throw big ropes up and over him or something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like between Pike and Scanlan and I-- Well, look, I feel like between Pike, Scanlan, and I and Percy with his mechanical genius, we can figure something amongst the spells that we know to make a viable trap.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we have 40 goliaths throw 40 chains attached to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're not all goliaths.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fine. 30 goliaths would throw 30 chains with 30 spikes on them at this dragon, I bet a few would hit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I could throw up a Blade Barrier on top of him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, we are super powerful. They're strong, we're smart, let's do this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If we kill it now, we're going to have to be-- if we kill it now, all the others are going to punish the people they're sitting upon, and we're not ready to go dragon to dragon to dragon like that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Will they? Dragons are vain, how do you know they won't just find that dragon weak and think that he's not worthy of them--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're going to know that something challenged his power and there are going to be consequences for it, they'll make a display of their strength.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a feeling they were very upset when we killed the blue one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So what, we're never going to kill any of the dragons, then? Because that will happen at some point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We will. We will. It's--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And they won't react then? It's-- this is our mission, to kill these dragons.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Once again, there's going to be consequences no matter what we do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, you guys have, as you hit the end of your sentence, Percy, you all look up and you all see the two-story building with a dark red brick contrasting against Wilhand's home, it's a deep-set heavy brick with dark wood siding to it, and it looks like dark marble finishes certain elements of the base of it, it matches the description that was given to you by Quall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like it's been ransacked at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like the door is partially ajar.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Partially ajar?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why don't we see how our favor holds? Let's take a moment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. If we find something cool, we kill the dragon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, we're leaving this up to a coin flip, now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 20 or a one, seems to work well for us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm curious what the fates would say.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sighs) I don't give a shit what the fates have to say.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do have a coin with a 20 and a one on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So what's the plan?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we going-- Silently, quietly walking up to the front door?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vax, if you would be so kind?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's already partially ajar.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Should we check it for traps first?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Check for traps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, if you want to make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Investigation, or is it-- perception is normally what I've done for traps, isn't it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Investigation's for traps, perception is to notice how to disarm it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27. You approach the front door, doesn't appear to be trapped, you open partly the door and the interior, fireplace is still going, and you see the crackle in the distance, fine furniture set up. There is the body of a goliath face-down on the ground about five feet from the front door, head splattered across the ground.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, he's dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also look around the circumstances, and you glance upward to where his head would be, and amongst all these stone tiles in the ceiling, there's one that's set slightly lower than the rest, right above where that splatter occurred.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (whispers) Traps!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Grog voice) It's a little brave, running around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, this is exactly what I was hoping for.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I need a minute, everybody. Everybody hang back, just for a second.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, do you want me to hang outside?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, Vex'ahlia, could you come here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course, brother.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. This is a death box, this room is a death box. And I have a keen eye, but I wouldn't mind another set.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: D'you want me to look around?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like us both to look around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: From out here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I said come inside.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can actually walk in?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. I stand exactly in front of the door and don't take any more steps.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come in. Aww, you're my bestie. All right, I'm going to start looking around for traps.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I look for traps visually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys make investigation checks as you slowly move forward at a slow pace.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I assist you guys?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you know, your music does calm and soothe me--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not with music, I'll send an invisible guy in there to start pressing on the floor and walls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, well, give us just a moment. Yeah, but that's a good idea. 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You eventually find your way across this area, marking quietly with an arrow or scraping the carpet where each one of these places are, but you make your way across the room to a staircase that leads up, staircase that leads down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bullshit, bullshit, lotta bullshit. All right, guys, I think it's safe to come into the first room. So you said, because I was being a jackass and saying bullshit, what was the description you just gave?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's stairs, we're at the bottom of the stairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's the main living area that has the fireplace, and then stairs that go up and stairs that go down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there doors in this main-- it's like a foyer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like a giant foyer area, there's an area that passes behind the stairs, something that would go into a kitchen area, like a dining room kitchen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's not split up, let's do this together.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's rich and paranoid, so if anything is of value it'll be downstairs, so I say we do upstairs first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does Trinket wait outside, or is Trinket following you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ohh. Trinket, dear? Come on, come on, d'you want to go in the locket? You do? If you don't, you can wait out here but it's probably safer in the locket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (disgruntled bear noises) Lumbers forward, gives you a look like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't be sad about it, if you don't want to, I'm not going to make you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket's pulled into the amulet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, I love him so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Amulet which you've now been in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was it like, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I left a little something in there for him. Time doesn't pass, right? Does time pass in the locket?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like a nintendo cartridge.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (fart noise) Raaaah! Goosh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I might not live past this. (fart noise) (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Got to leave your mark.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we check out the stairs and make sure nothing's wrong with the stairs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I did not see anything.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm fine. I got a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The stairs-- As you begin to inspect, you reach out and take the railing and take the first step and your foot passes through the stair.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ooh, that's not solid. At all. Look, put your foot through that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to stand here and watch you do it, actually.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to get down on my knees and stick my head through the stairs--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, what? Are you fucking kidding me right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go to try and stop him as he pushes his head through the step.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're a moron!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pass through this illusory staircase, and you look up and you can see the bottom half of the staircase. This area is a slide that descends into darkness. You having your darkvision can see that the slide descends into a now-cold furnace.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: D'you want to get your whole body in there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But can I see-- I pull my head up, what can I see at the top of the stairs, is there a landing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you look up and if you, from where the illusion is the illusory stairs stop at a ceiling, a stone ceiling that leads down, you can't look past it, looking up you can see a landing and a secondary floor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Is there any stray furniture around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's precariously placed--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are there any shitty pillows or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's like a couple throw pillows on the couch that are by the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are shitty pillows?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I totally ignore my sister, which is what I've done half my entire life, and I stick my head down and I let it go and watch it go down the slide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was that fun? Was that fu--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Singes the top of the roof area, where there's a bunch of wood, but the wood is not burned or charred and the flames die down again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, y'know, it wasn't fun, but it was educational, shithead. And I walk over and stop at the edge of the stairs going down, you said there were stairs going down?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who the fuck is this guy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know, I certainly like him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Same thing, I want to see-- could you help me over here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm looking, I'm checking out those stairs too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wise-arse.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wouldn't have slid down the fucking slide, I would assume that leads to death. I don't need to throw a pillow down the slide to know--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are very smart and wise. You know, we could be dead tomorrow, do you want to keep arguing with me like this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I got higher than that. 26.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could watch this all day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Partway down, you do see a slight carving in the stone, a glyph of some kind that is faintly hidden with dust and dirt placed to fill the gap. There is some sort of a symbol ever-so-faintly hidden in the stone halfway down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we read it? Do we understand it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: D'you know, the last time I saw something like that, the carpet was fucked. Do you think Wilhand would have any idea--?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, the-- no, the other carpet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oi!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know this rune over here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This-- what? I don't even see what you're talking about.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This little glowy rune right here. Look closely.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think that I have not seen anything like this before, but have I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an arcana check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It appears to be magical in nature. The symbols elude you, their construct, the arcane equation that is based around this, you can't tell if it's still functional or not, but it is magical in its construction.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Want to throw a pillow down there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What an interesting idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go get a pillow and I throw it at the rune.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How'd it work, does that, is that how you're supposed to do it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The pillow-- (impact) down the stairs.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, go get the pillow, try again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Try a lumbar. Maybe a different result.

lines.name: LAURA
